main event: A red-orange object described as a bright star moved rapidly across the night sky in Boundbrook, New Jersey on November 28, 1959.
interesting points: The object was seen moving at extreme speed,Two minutes was the estimated time of observation but the actual sighting duration was noted as 60 seconds,The sighting occurred at 10:30 PM,There is speculation that it could have been a high-flying jet,The witness described the object fading out slowly after about 12-15 seconds of movement.
sighted object: a red-orange object resembling a bright star
witness description: the witness described being around their car at night when they observed the object
